name: LoadJob
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob
description:
LoadJob

A Job subclass representing a load operation that may be performed on a Table. A LoadJob instance is created when you call Table#load.

methods.name: sources
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#sources
methods.description: The URI or URIs representing the Google Cloud Storage files from which the operation loads data.

methods.name: destination
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#destination
methods.description: The table into which the operation loads data. This is the table on which Table#load was invoked. Returns a Table instance.

methods.name: delimiter
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#delimiter
methods.description: The delimiter used between fields in the source data. The default is a comma (,).

methods.name: skip_leading_rows
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#skip_leading_rows
methods.description: The number of header rows at the top of a CSV file to skip. The default value is 0.

methods.name: utf8?
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#utf8?
methods.description: Checks if the character encoding of the data is UTF-8. This is the default.

methods.name: iso8859_1?
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#iso8859_1?
methods.description: Checks if the character encoding of the data is ISO-8859-1.

methods.name: quote
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#quote
methods.description: The value that is used to quote data sections in a CSV file. The default value is a double-quote ("). If your data does not contain quoted sections, the value should be an empty string. If your data contains quoted newline characters, #quoted_newlines? should return true.

methods.name: max_bad_records
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#max_bad_records
methods.description: The maximum number of bad records that the load operation can ignore. If the number of bad records exceeds this value, an error is returned. The default value is 0, which requires that all records be valid.

methods.name: quoted_newlines?
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#quoted_newlines?
methods.description: Checks if quoted data sections may contain newline characters in a CSV file. The default is false.

methods.name: json?
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#json?
methods.description: Checks if the format of the source data is newline-delimited JSON. The default is false.

methods.name: csv?
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#csv?
methods.description: Checks if the format of the source data is CSV. The default is true.

methods.name: backup?
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#backup?
methods.description: Checks if the source data is a Google Cloud Datastore backup.

methods.name: allow_jagged_rows?
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#allow_jagged_rows?
methods.description: Checks if the load operation accepts rows that are missing trailing optional columns. The missing values are treated as nulls. If false, records with missing trailing columns are treated as bad records, and if there are too many bad records, an error is returned. The default value is false. Only applicable to CSV, ignored for other formats.

methods.name: ignore_unknown_values?
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#ignore_unknown_values?
methods.description: Checks if the load operation allows extra values that are not represented in the table schema. If true, the extra values are ignored. If false, records with extra columns are treated as bad records, and if there are too many bad records, an invalid error is returned. The default is false.

methods.name: schema
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#schema
methods.description: The schema for the data. Returns a hash. Can be empty if the table has already has the correct schema (see Table#schema= and Table#schema), or if the schema can be inferred from the loaded data.

methods.name: input_file_bytes
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#input_file_bytes
methods.description: The number of bytes of source data.

methods.name: output_rows
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#output_rows
methods.description: The number of rows that have been loaded into the table. While an import job is in the running state, this value may change.

methods.name: output_bytes
title: Gcloud
Bigquery
LoadJob#output_bytes
methods.description: The number of bytes that have been loaded into the table. While an import job is in the running state, this value may change.
